sections.purpose: To hold culture plates in a sealed environment for anaerobic or microaerophilic growth.
sections.scope: Applicable to bench-top anaerobic cultivation in Microbiology.
procedure: Inspect the jar and lid for any cracks or damage.
Place the inoculated agar plates in the jar carrier.
Add an anaerobic gas-generating system and an indicator strip.
Align the lid and tighten the screw clamp or latch securely.
Verify the seal by checking for resistance or using a vacuum gauge if equipped.
Place the jar in the incubator.
Monitor the color change of the indicator strip.
Upon completion, release pressure (if applicable) and open the lid slowly.
Clean and dry the jar after each use.
precautions: Do not over-tighten the lid screws as it may damage the gasket.
Ensure the O-ring is seated correctly and free from debris.
Do not use the jar if the indicator fails to change color.
Handle the heavy lid with care to avoid injury or breakage.
Store the jar with the lid slightly open when not in use.
